bug.short_desc: lightdm-settings not starting due to missing dependency
bug.cf_doc_type: If docs needed, set a value

long_desc.thetext:
Description of problem: lightdm-settings can not start because of missing dependency, "python-setproctitle" package
Version-Release number of selected component (if applicable): 1.0.2-3.fc25
How reproducible: try to start utility, regardless through menu or terminal emulator
Steps to Reproduce: 1. Menu --> Administration --> Login Window 2. $ lightdm-settings 3.
Actual results: It fails to start
Expected results: It starts, GUI is appeared
Additional info: $ lightdm-settings Traceback (most recent call last): File "/usr/lib/lightdm-settings/lightdm-settings", line 3, in <module> import setproctitle ImportError: No module named 'setproctitle'
lightdm-settings-1.0.2-4.fc26 has been submitted as an update to Fedora 26. https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2017-10156f3c64

lightdm-settings-1.0.2-4.fc25 has been pushed to the Fedora 25 testing repository. If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report. See https://fedoraproject.org/wiki/QA:Updates_Testing for instructions on how to install test updates. You can provide feedback for this update here: https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2017-cff6e6af86
